intro: Acronia pallida, commonly known as the pale acronia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Acronia pallida is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and sensitive indicator of ecological health.
